Module Simulator
Package kin.env.obstaclesdyn

Class Cuboid

java.lang.Object
kin.env.obstacles.Obstacle
kin.env.obstacles.PolyhedricObstacle
kin.env.obstaclesdyn.Cuboid
public class Cuboid
extends PolyhedricObstacle
A cuboid dynamic obstacle. It can be moved by the robot.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

  • Constructor Details

    • Cuboid

      public Cuboid​(Cuboid otherCuboid)
      Copy constructor.
      Parameters:
      otherCuboid - cuboid to copy

    • Cuboid

      public Cuboid​(int id, double cx, double cy, double cz, double sizeX, double sizeY, double sizeZ, int[] color)
      Create a cuboid.
      Parameters:
      id - a unique cuboid number, according to the occurence in the environment file, used to identify balls. The id corresponds to the index in Environment.getCuboids(), i.e. environment.getCuboids().get(id) returns the respective cuboid.
      cx - center x
      cy - center y
      cz - center's height
      sizeX - size in x-direction
      sizeY - size in y-direction
      sizeZ - size in z-direction
      color - cuboid color

    • resetCuboid

      public void resetCuboid()
      Reset the cuboid's state to the original state when initializing the environment. I.e., the position is the one from the environment file.

    • insideOut

      public double[] insideOut​(double[] p)
      If the given point is inside the Cuboid, what is the shortest vector to move the point outside the Cuboid?
      Parameters:
      p - given point
      Returns:
      move-out vector or null, if the point is outside

    • nearestPoint3D

      public double[][][] nearestPoint3D​(double cx, double cy, double cz)
      Description copied from class: Obstacle

      Get the nearest obstacle's surface point (border, or top) to a given point. The distance is measured in 3D. The distance is measured to the border, even if the given point is inside the obstacle.

      Specified by:
      nearestPoint3D in class Obstacle
      Parameters:
      cx - given point (x)
      cy - given point (y)
      cz - given point (z)
      Returns:
      array with 3 elements [0]: collision, [1]: normal(s), [2] additional velocity. In details
      • [0][0]: nearest point x, y, z;
      • [1][0], [1][0]-[1][1] or [1][0]-[1][2]: surface unit normals that point to free space;
      • [2]==null or [2][0]: additional velocity in cm per ArmBot.SIMULATION_TICK_DELTA.

    • setGripped

      public void setGripped​(java.util.ArrayList<TouchPoint> tps)
      Set this cuboid as explicitly gripped by touchpoints of a gripper. If the cuboid was gripped before, the cuboid's new pose is computed according the gripper's touchpoint movement. As a result, the cuboid exactly follows the gripper's pose and not with the help of the gravitation model.
      Parameters:
      tps - gripper touchpoints that have contact to this cuboid

    • unsetGripped

      public void unsetGripped()
      Set this cuboid as not gripped by touchpoints of a gripper.

    • isGripped

      public boolean isGripped()
      Is this cuboid as gripped by touchpoints of a gripper?
      Returns:
      gripped?
